reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nicely situated hotel with a very classical interior. Nice bed and friendly staff. Limited on-site parking available, but plenty of paid space on the roads around the hotel. Based on my single night stay, this seems like a low-risk option if you're looking for a place in The Hague.
reviews.title: Nice stay, good value

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for a week while I was in The Hague on business and found it very comfortable and quiet. What I liked best was the very comfortable bed, strong hot shower, iPod speakers, espresso machine in the room, and the friendly service. The hotel provides free wifi with a comfortable desk, which made working from the room very easy. The room was a nice size, with plenty of storage for clothes. I didn't give it a 5 star because of the limited room service (and not everything on the very limited menu was available) and the lack of a gym. Also, housekeeping was not very good about replacing the hotel provided toiletries. I would definitely stay here again if I'm in The Hague on business.
reviews.title: A Nice Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was really suprrised of the quality of EVERYTHING in this charming lovelyhotel in the heart of The Hague, in embassy district. The hotel has 3 floors in 3 different styles, the rooms are very spaciuos (what a difference with a common Dutch hotel room sizes!). All rooms are differfent because the hotel is situated in the historical buiding. The bathrooms and bathtubes are big as well, the showers are spotless, the beds are comfy. There are a lot of small details which make this hotel so unique and charming, everything is arranged to make you happy (f.e. small lights for reaging next to your bed,bathrobe, sneakers, coffee/tea facilities, iron etc). The staff is incredibly polite and helpful (free upgrade because I asked for a different room!). And the last creschendo: I had there the best breakfast I could imagine in The Netherlands: from fresh salmon to brownies, from roasbeef to fresh fruits, delicious (almost French) croissants and a huge selection of bread, jam, cheese etc, everything fresh. And of course, the waiter is asking what kind of omelette would you prefer... 100% recommended, the best hotel I ever stayed in The Netherlands.
reviews.title: best hotel experience in The Netherlands

reviews.text: I was advised by a coworker to book this hotel for my meeting in the Hague for 7 people. It truly is a beautiful hotel - the rooms looked like mini doll houses. The staff was very nice and friendly. Location was great and it was walking distance to everywhere. Everyone was very pleased with the hotel and the service.
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel

reviews.text: Stayed one night at this hotel and was very pleased. Service is perfect from the staff: friendly and professional but all in a very natural, relaxed way. Room are nice, spacious, wifi internet, flat screen tv, high ceilings and very comfortable. Decor I would say is homely rather than modern or contemporary but that's no criticism, just an observation. There is a good bar in the basement. Breakfast was a buffet selection - good, standard buffet with eggs cooked to order. Would definitely stay here again. Location is a short walk from centre and there are some excellent restaurants in the area of the hotel too.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as a family. Hotel personnel were very friendly and accommodating, but some did not really know how to deal with a young child. For example, the baby bed provided was set up in an unsafe way and when we asked where we could change the baby after having checked out, we were directed to the bathroom, where we had to change the baby on the floor because there was no changing table.
reviews.title: Not suitable for families with young children

reviews.text: Rooms are overdecorated but the view is nice. Climate in the room was a bit cold and the only heating system seemed to be the air conditioning system. Rooms are noisy, everything can be heard in the hallway.
reviews.title: Excellent, friendly service

reviews.text: Interestingly, the sound of the tv is transmitted to the bathroom.
reviews.title: Terrific location and wonderful staff

reviews.text: Service was good, except the restaurant, some orders did not arrive or arrived very late, and apparently there was a shortage of glasses.
reviews.title: Old World Ambiance Where Service Excels

reviews.text: Hotel has no sports facilities.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel Wondeful staff, excellent food breakfast and dinner slightly faded

reviews.text: This is indeed a nice and comfortable hotel in a quiet quarter of Den Haag. You can reach the city centre within a short walk, and you may also take the tramway going to Scheveningen and the city centre, the station being only 2 minutes from the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice, but some unlovely details
Friendly, beautiful and comfortable
reviews.text: Weekend internet rates are very attractive, however, the deluxe room we stayed in was quite small. It had a nice balcony which obviously was the reason for qualifiying the room as a deluxe room, but in february the balcony was not that useful... The carpet in our room was worn-out, and next to the bed there was a big stain. I am sorry to say but it looked as if someone had vomited on the floor. This added to some other stains on the carpet and a remarkable hole in one of the bathroom towels. All in all, the room was not worthy of a four star hotel.
Breakfast buffet, however, was quite good.
reviews.title: Cozy, comfortable and luxurious
Classy Hotel with Great Weekend Rates
reviews.text: This is a small hotel in the middle of The Hague but still in a quit beatiful area. The staff is so friendly that you feel right at home. The prices are great in the weekend and the restaurant serves great food. The rooms are romantic and comfortable and very inportant clean. You can walk in to the city centre from the hotel within 5 minutes.

reviews.title: Very relaxing
reviews.text: This is a small but comfortable and luxurious hotel in a quiet but convenient area of Den Haag. The rooms are traditional dutch style with pleasant floral design, comfortable beds and nice furnishings. Good restaurants and shopping are just a short stroll away. Rooms were clean. Bath tub was large. Separate shower was small but powerful. Breakfast was good, but not great. The small lobby has a comfortable fireplace area. Hotel staff and service was excellent.

reviews.title: Great hotel, but a touch of "going dutch"
reviews.text: Stayed here for a long weekend in November to visit family. Great location in a quiet but well located neighborhood in The Hague. We had a very comfortable room with a nice view of trees and the neighboring villa. Nice bathroom with a great shower and good water pressure. Very friendly service and a good breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now for the "going dutch" part: (1) it is ostensibly a 4 star hotel, but you are invited/encouraged to carry your own bags to your room (not such a big deal unless you have giant bags which we did not); and (2) more annoyingly, we stayed here in November, and both radiators in the room were turned off when we checked in and when we returned to the hotel in the evening- I manually turned them on (no thermostat) for the night, only to discover in the afternoon the next day that they had been turned off again. I can understand not wanting to heat empty rooms, but hey, once I am checked in, it would be nice to have heat... I gather that Dutch tend to keep their apartments and houses pretty cold in the winter, presumably to save on heating bills, but in a 4 star hotel? The room did heat up pretty quickly and the down comforter would have have been fine at minus 5 degrees...
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel

likes.liked: — quiet location near towncentre, the nice terrace

reviews.text: I still rate this hotel very highly because of the value and the comfort despite the "going dutch" comments above.
reviews.title: Very nice indeed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent choice. The hotel is situated in a very peaceful and beautiful square. The location is very convenient : towncentre is just a 10 minutes walk. And if you prefer to take a tram, the tramstop is just a 150 meter away. You can take tram 10 to Schevingen (10 minutes) or Delft in the other direction (20 minutes).
reviews.title: Delightful hotel

likes.liked: — Good position, friendly staff and comfortable bedroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was spacious and attractively decorated. The bathroom with Delft tiles was a nice touch. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast buffet was good, as could be expected from a 4star hotel. You can dine there too, but not on a sunday evening. We didn't try it, because there are a lot of small restaurants in the neighbourhood. But we certainly enjoyed the nice glass of rosé wine in the sun on the terrace.
reviews.title: Ideal hotel for weekend away

likes.liked: — Quality of the hotel and professionalism of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in a quiet leafy part of town but is close to shopping, restaurants and bars (Noordeinde and Prinsessewal) although it is a 25 minute walk / 10 minute tram ride to the train station. Check-in was friendly and the receptionist was extremely helpful throughout our stay.
reviews.title: Relax in quiet surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our spacious and well equipped top-floor room overlooked the front of the hotel and the Canadian Embassy across the road. The room was very nicely decorated with relaxing colour schemes. Everything was clean and tidy apart from a couple of marks on one of the walls and a slightly loose handle by the bath. I especially liked the selection of large towels in the bathroom - quite different to some hotels that think a couple of postage stamp-sized clothes are enough. The best part of the room was the extremely comfortable bed and feather pillows.
reviews.title: Very friendly and helpful atmosphere

reviews.text: Breakfast wasn't included in our rate and seemed expensive but there are so many cafés nearby, especially in the area around Plaats, so we chose to eat out.
reviews.title: nice hotel , mixed experience

reviews.text: The hotel offers relaxation and peace and is a great base to explore Delft which is just 29 minutes on the No.1 tram (there are 2 tram stops around the corner on Alexanderstraat). For a chill out at the beach try nearby Scheveningen.
reviews.title: The amazing service here is the perfect companion to the beautiful rooms.

reviews.text: This is a very pleasant hotel. Not glitzy and modern but clean and smart and much more to our taste. The staff are all very helpful and friendly and being Holland they all speak perfect English. They didn't come out to the car to help with the baggage which I might have expected, but they did offer help later, but other than that the service was fine. The room was large and quiet with very comfortable bed. We ate all our meals outside on the terrace which was very pleasant and not at all noisy as the hotel is in a nice residential part of town. We found the various pages of the menu a bit confusing and although the food was good it was a bit too fussy for us. A few plain Dutch offerings might be a good idea? The wine list was good with no silly prices. The hotel is an easy walk into the old town which is lovely.
reviews.title: Quiet and nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I love all things Dutch and spent two nights at the Carlton Ambassador in Den Haag in mid-January, for a bargain price. The hotel was brilliant, really one of the best we've stayed at in Europe.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is good, on a quiet square and about 10 minutes walk from the centre of Den Haag. It's about 2 mins walk to a tram stop if you don't fancy walking though, and you can take that tram line to both Delft and Scheveningen, which we did.
reviews.title: Classy

likes.liked: — All rooms very well appointed and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were super-friendly. We often find that because we are both young, hotel staff sometimes don't take us as seriously as they would older guests, but not at this hotel. The staff were very kind and helpful. We checked in late, near midnight, and that was no problem either.
reviews.title: Cosy and romantic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large and nicely decorated. The bathroom was a touch smaller than we might have liked, but it had an excellent shower, which was really powerful. We also had breakfast included, and that was more than adequate too, and served till 10.30 which we appreciated on a relaxing weekend.
reviews.title: Best buy!

reviews.text: Basically I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, it was brilliant and is the only place I'd stay in Den Haag!
reviews.title: don't take discounted rates

reviews.text: Located in the heart of den Haag, this hotel is comfortable and clean. The receptionist was exceedingly polite and helpful and like most Dutch people, spoke English fluently.
reviews.title: Perfect for business and a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was average in size, had pleasant decor, a queen size bed, nice bathroom, minibar, trouser press, iron, safe, free WiFi, plenty of towels, work area and a flatscreen TV. There were BBC channels and other languages available as well as radio. A note of warning to parents with younger children - there is an adult channel that is free to view and leaves nothing to the imagination.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: The bathroom had a bath as well as a separate shower that was nice and powerful. The twin toilet roll holder was set very close to the toilet though. I had a problem with the bed insomuch as it has a memory foam mattress. This was the first time I had slept on such a mattress and it seemed to dip towards the middle of the bed making it as though I was sleeping on an incline. There were 2 of these mattresses on the bed. The pillows were also memory foam. My preference is still for duck & goose filling in a pillow and a good hard sprung mattress but I am sure this memory foam will suit many others.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with its own style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I ordered breakfast in my room and it was classic Dutch with cold meats and cheese as well as scrambled egg and fruit. There is a small charge for room service of €4.50 and it arrived on time.
reviews.title: 5 Star treatment at this great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Checking out was done in less than a minute and was very efficient.
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect breakfast
